channel.title: Adding models ~ adding integers to class8.java ~
channel.description:
i Read.. " 1. You will need the model id and the ints, so what your gonna have to do is find the number of the gzipped model, for eg. model 12325.gz and you have to add it to the ints 2. The ints must be placed in the class8.java file in your client 3. Compile your client and restart it. 4. You need to go in game and say add model ##### out loud 5. Restart your client. " for step two, where do i add the model number in the .java file[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 19, 2008, 10:15:14 pm[/size][hr]i found a TUT but im still having problems... i add the .gz (gzipped model) into the model folder... i go into class8.java when i paste one of the codes into class8.java.. [size=8pt]
if(i == ####){ //item id class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anInt174 = 1;//inventory/drop model class8.anInt181 = 1180;//dont change class8.anInt190 = 452;//dont change class8.anInt198 = 0;//dont change class8.anInt204 = 0;//dont change class8.anInt169 = -1;//dont change class8.anInt194 = -1;//dont change class8.anInt165 = 1;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = 1;//female wearing class8.anInt175 = -1;//dont change class8.anInt197 = -1;//dont change class8.aString170 = "Item Name";//item name class8.aByteArray178 = "Item info".getBytes();//examine info }
[/size] and i make it into one of the models i have added, 2983.gz etc and make it look like: [size=8pt]
if(i == 2983){ //item id class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anInt174 = 1;//inventory/drop model class8.anInt181 = 1180;//dont change class8.anInt190 = 452;//dont change class8.anInt198 = 0;//dont change class8.anInt204 = 0;//dont change class8.anInt169 = -1;//dont change class8.anInt194 = -1;//dont change class8.anInt165 = 1;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = 1;//female wearing class8.anInt175 = -1;//dont change class8.anInt197 = -1;//dont change class8.aString170 = "archer plate";//item name class8.aByteArray178 = "archer plate...".getBytes();//examine info }
[/size] so i compile, log into client say: add model 2983 it says its been added successfully... then i restart my client, and its a null... i have tried this two times, the halo sniper model just copied the model below it, (just the same thing as the model below it but name and examine info was changed to sniper info) the TUT: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,262499.0.html

item.title: Adding models ~ adding integers to class8.java ~
item.dc:creator: @nikkohayden nikkohayden
item.description:
@nikkohayden wrote:

i Read…

"
1.
You will need the model id and the ints, so what your gonna have to do is find the number of the gzipped model, for eg. model 12325.gz and you have to add it to the ints

The ints must be placed in the class8.java file in your client

Compile your client and restart it.

You need to go in game and say add model ##### out loud

Restart your client.

"

for step two, where do i add the model number in the .java file[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 19, 2008, 10:15:14 pm[/size][hr]i found a TUT but im still having problems…

i add the .gz (gzipped model) into the model folder…

i go into class8.java

when i paste one of the codes into class8.java…
[size=8pt]

if(i == ####){ //item id
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anInt174 = 1;//inventory/drop model
class8.anInt181 = 1180;//dont change
class8.anInt190 = 452;//dont change
class8.anInt198 = 0;//dont change
class8.anInt204 = 0;//dont change
class8.anInt169 = -1;//dont change
class8.anInt194 = -1;//dont change
class8.anInt165 = 1;//male wearing
class8.anInt200 = 1;//female wearing
class8.anInt175 = -1;//dont change
class8.anInt197 = -1;//dont change
class8.aString170 = “Item Name”;//item name
class8.aByteArray178 = “Item info”.getBytes();//examine info
}
[/size]

and i make it into one of the models i have added, 2983.gz etc and make it look like:
[size=8pt]

if(i == 2983){ //item id
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anInt174 = 1;//inventory/drop model
class8.anInt181 = 1180;//dont change
class8.anInt190 = 452;//dont change
class8.anInt198 = 0;//dont change
class8.anInt204 = 0;//dont change
class8.anInt169 = -1;//dont change
class8.anInt194 = -1;//dont change
class8.anInt165 = 1;//male wearing
class8.anInt200 = 1;//female wearing
class8.anInt175 = -1;//dont change
class8.anInt197 = -1;//dont change
class8.aString170 = “archer plate”;//item name
class8.aByteArray178 = “archer plate…”.getBytes();//examine info
}
[/size]

so i compile, log into client say: add model 2983

it says its been added successfully…

then i restart my client, and its a null…

i have tried this two times, the halo sniper model just copied the model below it, (just the same thing as the model below it but name and examine info was changed to sniper info)

the TUT:
